agency_desc: A public lbrary that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Offers delivery of requested library materials (as they are available) to Knightstown residents in Henry County who are homebound due to chronic or extended illness, physical disability, or extreme transportation problems.
site_details: Call to request service..
site_schedule: Mon and Fri 10am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 10am-7pm; Sat 10am-2pm -- Book Deliveries: By request
Mon and Fri 10am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 10am-7pm; Sat 10am-2pm
Mon and Fri 10am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 10am-7pm; Sat 10am-2pm
site_eligibility: Living in the town of Knightstown in Henry County -- Homebound due to chronic or extended illness or physical disability

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Library: Mon-Thurs 10am-7pm; Fri 10am-5pm; Sat 10am-3pm -- Book Deliveries: By request
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Fall Creek Township or within the Shenandoah school district of Henry County

agency_name: NEW CASTLE - HENRY COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY
agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call or visit the website for information. www.nchcpl.org
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Henry County

agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
service_description: Provides education support for students with disabilities and special needs. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student. Assessment and special education services are generally accessed through the assigned public school.
site_details: Call for information about special education services.
site_eligibility: Living in Charles A. Beard Memorial, Nettle Creek, New Castle Community, Shenandoah, South Henry, or Union school districts -- Age 3-22 years-old -- With special needs, including developmental, vision, and hearing impairments

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or own property in the town of Spiceland or Spiceland Township in Henry County

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable and frozen food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Living in southern Henry County or northern Rush County (along US 40)

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization offering a variety of charitable outreach programs to residents in Henry, Hancock, Fayette, and Rush counties.
service_description: Offers a six-month transitional rehabilitation program for men committed to recovery from substance use. A comprehensive curriculum incorporating both faith- and evidence-based methods is utilized. Additional support services (including case management, personal development classes, and recovery coaching) as well as meals, shower and laundry facilities, and clothing and hygiene items are are also provided.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
Substance Use Disorder Peer Recovery Coach Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Substance Use Disorder Peer Recovery Coach Services
site_details: Call during intake hours to request an assessment.
site_schedule: Store: Tues–Sat 10am-4pm -- Donation Drop-Off: Mon-Sun 8am-7pm -- Donation Pickup: Tues and Thurs 9am-3pm by appointment only
Store: Tues–Sat 10am-4pm -- Donation Drop-Off: Mon-Sun 8am-7pm -- Donation Pickup: Tues and Thurs 9am-3pm by appointment only
Store: Tues–Sat 10am-4pm -- Donation Drop-Off: Mon-Sun 8am-7pm -- Donation Pickup: Tues and Thurs 9am-3pm by appointment only
site_eligibility: Adult men age 18 or older -- Committed to recovery from substance use -- Willing to adhere to all program requirements (including weekly attendance at one religious service and five devotions) -- Able to climb stairs and practice hygiene independently -- Current on any medication(s) prescribed for mental illness -- Not taking any narcotic medications -- Already completed detox and not in active withdrawal -- Without sex-related felony convictions

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call, walk in, or email for information.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing confidential pregnancy testing and information regarding abortion alternatives and crisis pregnancy support. This agency also offers material assistance.
service_description: Provides free baby supplies to those in need. Diapers, baby food, and baby clothing (up tosize 6T) are generally available. Selection may vary based on donations. Limit one visit per month for most items; one visit per week for diapers.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Parent with young children (up to size 6T) -- Not received diapers from this pantry within the past week -- Not received other baby supplies from this pantry within the past month

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in the city of New Castle in Henry County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market accept Senior and WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program checks for qualifying food items.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Knightstown in Henry County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Knightstown in Henry County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the station, which is the Knightstown City dispatch during or after business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Knightstown in Henry County

agency_desc: Provides in-home, personalized care which includes assistance with activities of daily living and homemaker services.
service_description: Provides in-home non-medical respite care to seniors, persons with disabilities, and persons recovering from an injury, illness, or surgery to relieve a caregiver.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides primary medical care for persons of all ages. Medical care is provided by nurse practitioners and includes treatment for minor illnesses and injuries, regular wellness checkups, and other basic medical services.
site_details: Call to schedule appointment or walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A community action agency that designs, sponsors, and administers programs that provide help for today and hope for tomorrow.
site_name: INTERLOCAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - HENRY COUNTY
service_description: Provides an early education program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children. Income guidelines may be waived for children with special needs or disabilities. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at several locations. Transportation is provided within set boundaries.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_eligibility: Children ages 3-5 years-old (Age 3 by August 1st) -- Children who are: in low-income households, in foster care, homeless, and/or from families receiving public assistance (TANF or SSI) -- other special circumstances (such as disabilities) may be considered.

agency_desc: A community action agency that designs, sponsors, and administers programs that provide help for today and hope for tomorrow.
service_description: Provides affordable reproductive health services to uninsured and underinsured women. Options include low-cost pelvic exams and Pap tests, mammograms, testing and treatment for sexually transmitted diseases/infections, and birth control options. Free and confidential pregnancy testing and verification are also available, as well as physician referrals and Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP 2.0)/Medicaid enrollment assistance. All exams are performed by a nurse practitioner; mammograms performed at Henry County Hospital.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- Uninsured or under-insured (including those with high deductibles)

agency_desc: A community action agency that designs, sponsors, and administers programs that provide help for today and hope for tomorrow.
service_description: Offers exercise, games, lectures, nutritional instruction, and educational enrichment for area seniors.
site_details: Call for information or to participate in programs.
site_eligibility: Age 55 or older (or spouse of someone 55 or older)

agency_desc: A nonprofit, member-owned energy cooperative providing electric utility services.
service_description: Provides electric utility services for Henry County and limited portions of surrounding counties. Budget and prepaid options are available.
site_details: Call for assistance. Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address. -- New customers must complete an application online or in person for service.
site_eligibility: Open; serves all of Henry County and limited portions of Delaware, Fayette, Hancock, Madison, Randolph, Rush, and Wayne counties in Indiana

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Provides education, referral, and support services to those trying to conceive, pregnant women, and new parents in an effort to eliminate disparities in birth outcomes and improve infant survival rates. Program topics may include infant safety, parenting techniques, breastfeeding support, and smoking cessation. Case management services, with home visits as needed, are also offered.
site_details: Call or email for more information or to request an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Fayette, Henry, Jackson, Jefferson, Rush, Scott, Union, or Wayne County -- Trying to conceive -OR - Currently pregnant -OR- with a child age 18 months or younger

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit that meets human needs without discrimination.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Henry County -- Visits limited to once every 14 days

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization that operates a food pantry for Henry County.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food, and hygiene supplies to those in need.
site_details: Walk in and sign in.
site_eligibility: Living in east central Indiana -- Limit one (1) visit every other week

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that provides food and housing services for area homeless and hungry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need living in Henry County.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Shelter intake: Daily 24 hours -- Henry County Sheriff Department: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm (for background checks)
site_eligibility: Limit one (1) visit every 14 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing charitable outreach services, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in. -- Call outside of normal service hours for emergency service.
site_schedule: Monthly 2nd and 4th Tues 3pm-5pm (alternate times for emergencies)
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based organization with a mission "to provide compassionate Rescue services on an immediate and/or long-term basis to the poor and needy of Muncie and East Central Indiana."
service_description: Offers new and gently used clothing, furniture, appliances, and miscellaneous household items at discounted prices. Proceeds benefit Muncie Mission Ministries food, shelter, recovery, vocational, and family services programs.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: BLUE RIVER TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - HENRY COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: BLUE RIVER TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - HENRY COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in. Pantry is located on north side of building. -- Complete income-based application (only photo ID required).
site_eligibility: Limited to residents of Knightstown, Dunreith, Greensboro, Kennard, Raysville, Shirley, and Spiceland

agency_name: SOUTH MEMORIAL DRIVE CHURCH OF GOD
agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
site_name: SOUTH MEMORIAL DRIVE CHURCH OF GOD
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in; please use the far-north door.
site_eligibility: Living in Henry County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Henry County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_name: HENRY COUNTY PROSECUTOR - CHILD SUPPORT DIVISION
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Henry County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Phone: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm -- Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
Phone: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm -- Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Henry County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Henry County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Henry County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Henry County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Henry County

agency_desc: Provides safety planning, protective order assistance, court accompaniment, information, referrals, a crisis line, and other support services for victims of domestic violence and sexual assault in Henry County.
service_description: Provides safety planning, protective order assistance, court accompaniment, information, referrals, and other support services for victims of domestic violence and sexual assault in Henry County.
site_details: Call for information or assistance, or walk in during the designated hours. Appointments can be arranged outside those hours, as needed.
site_eligibility: Living or staying in Henry County -- Victim of domestic violence or sexual assault

agency_desc: A full service hospital providing outpatient and inpatient health care.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. Call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A full service hospital providing outpatient and inpatient health care.
service_description: Offers a walk-in clinic for minor injuries and illnesses, standard health tests and screenings, immunizations, and physicals for school, sports, or work.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A full service hospital providing outpatient and inpatient health care.
site_name: PEDIATRICS AT NEW CASTLE FAMILY AND INTERNAL MEDICINE
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for Henry County youth who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. All school-required vaccines are available.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance doesn't cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
service_description: Offers affordable primary health care for uninsured and underinsured people. Services include family practice, pediatrics, sexually transmitted disease screenings, women's health services, laboratory testing, immunizations, diabetes treatment, asthma treatment, and patient education.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

agency_desc: A government organization that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Henry County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards, such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Henry County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of New Castle in Henry County.
service_description: Provides curb-to-curb, reservations-based transportation primarily within New Castle city limits. Walk-on service is available from select scheduled stops. All buses are wheelchair accessible; discounts are available for eligible seniors, youth, and those with a qualified disability.
site_details: Call to make a reservation; same-day reservations are available. -- Riders are accepted without a reservation at the following sites: Walmart and Maplewood Terrace Apartments.
site_schedule: Business Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Reservations: Mon-Fri 7:45am-noon and 12:30pm-4pm
Business Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Reservations: Mon-Fri 7:45am-noon and 12:30pm-4pm
site_eligibility: Traveling within New Castle city limits or to select nearby destinations (including the ICAP Office, Memorial Park-Smith Building, and Brooks Harbour)

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of New Castle in Henry County.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of New Castle in Henry County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding city government and services.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of New Castle in Henry County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of New Castle in Henry County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, snow and ice control, street-sign  maintenance, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of New Castle in Henry County. This department also provides curbside trash pickup and seasonal leaf vacuuming for New Castle residents.
site_details: Call or visit website for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of New Castle in Henry County

agency_desc: Provides animal control and sheltering services for the city of New Castle and other participating municipalities in Henry County.
service_description: Accepts donations of pet food and supplies for shelter use. Needed items are wet and dry dog/cat food, cat litter, and cleaning supplies. Volunteers to assist with shelter duties, including walking animals, socializing, and fostering animals are also welcome.
site_details: Call or walk in to make donation arrangements or to inquire about volunteering.
site_schedule: Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours -- Shelter: Mon-Fri noon-4pm; Sat 10am-noon
Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours -- Shelter: Mon-Fri noon-4pm; Sat 10am-noon
Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours -- Shelter: Mon-Fri noon-4pm; Sat 10am-noon

agency_desc: Provides animal control and sheltering services for the city of New Castle and other participating municipalities in Henry County.
service_description: Offers low-cost vaccinations, heartworm or FeLV/FIV testing, flea and heartworm preventative, and deworming. Additional veterinary services may be available; sliding-scale fees are available.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs for the city of New Castle.
service_description: Offers subsidized, income-based rental apartments to qualified seniors or persons with disabilities at the Maplewood Terrace apartment complex in the city of New Castle. Applications to be placed on the wait list are currently being accepted.
site_details: Visit website to apply on line.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-4:30pm; Wed 8am-noon
Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-4:30pm; Wed 8am-noon
site_eligibility: Low income -- Seniors, age 50 or older (those over age 61 receive preference) -OR- Adults, age 18 or older, with a disability

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Henry County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Henry County, which is then used to assess taxes.  Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk in during business hours for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Henry County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of New Castle in Henry County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of New Castle in Henry County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Henry County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of New Castle in Henry County

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of New Castle in Henry County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of New Castle and Henry Township of Henry County. Persons in need of emergency services in New Castle should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization offering substance abuse counseling and support services.
service_description: Offers a faith-based, 12-Step support group for persons struggling with substance abuse or other addictions. Monthly meetings are confidential and open to all.
site_details: Call to confirm meeting schedule.
site_eligibility: Open to all experiencing substance abuse or any addiction and their families, friends and persons who have lost a loved one to addiction.

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Henry County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways. Offers sandbags to Henry County households during times of flooding.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Henry County dispatch. -- For sandbags during times of flooding, be prepared to fill and haul sandbags.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Henry County)

agency_name: HENRY COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
agency_desc: A government agency providing educational activities, programs, and services related to recycling.
site_name: HENRY COUNTY SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT DISTRICT
service_description: Provides information and referral services as well as educational activities related to recycling in Henry County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information or to see upcoming events schedule.
site_schedule: District Recycling Center: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Drop-off site hours vary by location; see website for details.
District Recycling Center: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Drop-off site hours vary by location; see website for details.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that matches at-risk youth with adult mentors.
service_description: Matches children in need with professionally supported adult mentors who have shared interests and goals. Mentors volunteer two to four times per month for at least one year.
site_details: To Volunteer: Call or visit website to complete application. -- To Request a Mentor for a Child: Call or complete online enrollment form.
site_eligibility: Living in Henry County -- Adult Mentors: Age 18 or older -- Youth Participants: Ages 6-18 at time of enrollment

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including limited financial assistance for utility bills.
service_description: Provides emergency utility assistance for persons in need. Assistance may be received once every six months and is not available for deposits or reconnect fees for residents in Henry county.
site_details: Call to schedule assessment.
site_eligibility: Not received assistance within the past 6 months -- Not disconnected

agency_name: RAINTREE HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF HENRY COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families in Henry County.
site_name: RAINTREE HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF HENRY COUNTY
service_description: Sells donated building supplies, used appliances, and other home items to the general public at a discount. Donations accepted during store hours or by arrangement. Pickup (within set boundaries) is available for large-item donations.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open
